name: Grupotel Gravina

reviews.text: We recently spent 8 wonderful days in Barcelona (28th of June to 5th of July). During this trip we stayed 3 nights at the H10 Gravina, and 4 nights at the H10 Marina. We were fortunate to stay in magnificent rooms (suites) at each hotel. The hotels are both excellently located, clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly, professional , and eager to please. The breakfast at the Gravina is very good, and world class at the Marina.
reviews.title: Loved Barcelona

reviews.text: Based on this experience we now intend where possible to use the H10 group when we visit Spain.
reviews.title: Beware the standard room
Comfortable hotel in a great location for exploring the city.
reviews.text: Just a few points that may help fellow traveller:

To keep the room cooler, keep the curtains/sun screens closed during the day. Removing the bedspreads and blankets also makes sleeping more comfortable. There is air conditioning but in the height of summer do not expect artic temperatures.
reviews.title: Great Location
Great location and comfortable hotel
reviews.text: Spend a whole day at the Montserrat Monastery.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: We have just come back from a hen weekend in Barcelona. To be honest I was expecting something cheap and cheerful but was very pleasently surprised. The hotel was extremely clean and well kept. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and the breakfast had a great selection. I would recommend this to anyone - very impressed!!

Stayed for 2 nights at the Gravina. The hotel check in was very fast and efficient. The room was very spacious with a reasonable sized bathroom. it was situated in what seemed to be the annexe part of the hotel. The room we were in did not have a balcony and did not have any view apart from walls of another building ,but why worry when you are only 5 minutes from the Ramblas.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a superb location at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Quiet central position

likes.disliked: — Restaurant not very suitable for dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had four nights bed and breakfast in this well-situated 3 star hotel.We were not offered cava at the check-in desk although it was there in front of us.We didn't mind as we are not overly fond of cava.Anyway it was there for all at breakfast if we had wanted.
reviews.title: Wonderful Small Hotel

reviews.text: Our room 620 was small but had the useful addition of a terrace.I asked for a balcony but that was not available.The terrace was lovely although the view was pretty nondescript.Rooms 620 and 621 are in the annexe and have the useful terraces but 622 and 623 must be awfully cramped as they do not have that facility.
reviews.title: The great champagne welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good with a fine selection of cold meats and a limited hot buffet.Cakes were gorgeous and juices were delicious.Good quality coffee and delightful service from very p[leasant staff.Free Internet access in the foyer was welcome.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
not disappointed
reviews.text: booked on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed.Ideally located for La Rambla etc,rooms very clean if a bit small,with modern flat screen TV with multi channels.Breakfast inclusive is a MUST,as there is an extensive range of hot and cold food.The staff are very attentive,and once they discovered it was my birthday,they sent up a bottle of fizz to my room;a great gesture from what is remember only a 3 Star offer.Internet access in the lobby is FREE,which is a bonus for the teenagers during quiet times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very poor experience at this hotel.
reviews.title: Room not as advertised

likes.disliked: — Misleading website, compounded by MOST unhelpful reception staff

reviews.text: We booked a 5 night stay--booking a double room via Hotels.com. The choice of rooms was: double, single or suite. The double room illustrated on the web-site looked OK, so we booked it & in order to secure the quoted price, paid up-front.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the money

reviews.text: We arrived from England at 9.30 pm & were given a room that was nothing like the room illustrated. It was 8ft 6 x 10ft 6!!
reviews.title: Close to public transport

likes.liked: — It's location and the professional attitude of the staff

reviews.text: We asked to change rooms, & were refused, being told that that was the room we had paid for. The web-site picture, we were told, was misleading!!
reviews.title: Could not be faulted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked one night at this hotel for 21st Feb as was due to travel to Andorra on the Friday. However due to unforseen circumstances my airline cancelled the flight to Barcelona. I therefore had to find alternative flights and the only one I could get was to fly to Girona. It therefore made sense to travel to Andorra from Girona rather than Barcelona. I contacted Hotels.com to let them know the situation at least three weeks before I was due to stay at the hotel asking if they could cancel the hotel. They could cancel the hotel but there would be no refund of any monies. I find this shocking that a hotel has this policy. I can understand if you are cancelling within a week but to cancel up to three weeks before and not be offered any refund is staggering. I will never look to use this hotel again and I will be watching out for this in the future. Be warned !!!
reviews.title: Watch the cancellation guidelines at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife just returned from barcelona excellent little hotel clean modernand staff very helpful. Great location right by plaza catalunya plenty of tapas bars close by and good shopping for the wife.
reviews.title: great little place couple liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others we booked the hotel following the positive reviews on this site. It certainly lived up to expectations.
reviews.title: Good Standard; Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Graviina II which is linked to the main hotel. It does mean a little walk from reception but it really isn't far and I think this part of the hotel complex must have the larger rooms. Ours was an excellent size, something I hadn't expected given some of the reviews read.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with everyone who praised the reception given on arrival. The breakfast too was full of choice and the breakfast room light and airy.
reviews.title: a little gem of a hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel based on another H10 property I stayed at before. The hotel has two parts old and new and the Gravina II was a little confusing to get to but enough signs to find your way. However the room (#524)we got was horrible. There was water damage all over the walls and smell wasn't very pleasant and the heater wasn't working so we asked to change rooms. They gave us #324 but same thing. They offered us extra blankets but we were a bit irritated now, then finally they found us a room #322 which was perfect. Only had one double instead of the two twins we requested, but I was staying with my mom so it didn't matter. After our room saga was over I have nothing but nice things to say about the hotel. Free internet is always a plus!!! The was staff was really helpful and always recommended an good place to eat. Besides the room issue I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Another Good H10

reviews.text: Just got back from a two night stay here. The hotel was in a great location, within walking distance from all the main Old City attractions. The staff were helpful and the room clean, tidy and decorated well. Only niggle was that we were in the "new part" which consisted of a lift to the second floor, walk along a corridor and up another two flights of stairs. The room overlooked an ugly courtyard and didn't have a courtyard, which didn't bother us in winter, but I'm sure if it had been hot summer it would have been a pain. Oh, and our room was in the no smoking corridor that had an ash tray next to the lift and two in the room, although you couldnt actually smell any cigarettes.
reviews.title: Bagain little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I as well as my parents spent the Easter weekend in the Gravina. We had a room exactly above the entrance (facing the street), my parents slept in a room at the back site of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All together I follow the reviews of the other guests: this is not a quiet hotel (neither on the street side nor the back side), because a lot noise is coming from inside the hotel (it's an old building). Some reviewers said they heard someting "as if someone was moving furniture" - I guess it's the cabinets' doors of the rooms above. Still, we managed to sleep well.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are kept pretty clean every day, the service is very attentive and the Gravina's breakfast (approx. 17 EUR per Person) has a good value if you like to start the day with a full stomach (otherwise I would recommend the nearby Cafe Zurich).
reviews.title: good location but disappointing room
Excellent Location in the Catalan capital !
reviews.text: Next time I come to Barcelona I would stay in the Gravina again. Even though it might be a bit noisy I doubt other centrally located hotels would be quieter (remember: Barcelona is a loud city...).

This was a nice hotel in a good area to explore. On arrival we were greated with a glass of bubbly or juice. We arrived there early and our room was ready which was great. Our room was on the road so it was very noisy at night and because the room was quite hot we had to sleep with the window open, again this was extremely noisy. The bathroom was okay except for the water from the shower going everywhere, but this was not a problem as I used one of the towels and reception bought me up some more towels quite quickly. The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Central location Clean and tidy - but small

reviews.text: Just returned from 3 night stay at Gravina hotel, selected following recommendations on your site. Booked a triple room(3 adults) and whilst not huge was perfectly adequate for our needs.Twin beds and small alcove with sofa bed. I was impressed by the friendly reception and free glass of cava on arrival. Couldn't check in til 2pm, but they did hold our passports and suitcases whilst we went and did a little sightseeing. Immaculately clean hotel, centrally located just off Place de Catalunya and La Ramblas,so not too noisy. Excellent hot and cold buffet breakfast sets you up for the day. Only negative was no view, but how important is that really? Got my camera stolen so be careful with your bags - again hotel staff were fab and helped me fill the police report out on-line.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: This hotel was lovely, beautiful clean, modern, rooms and bathrooms and our room overlooked the street and had a balcony which was an added bonus (good to hang the washing out too!) Only complaints would be the beds, they were as hard as rocks and my side went numb during the night. The queen size bed was just two singles put together and they were made up seperately and on wheels so it was a bit difficult to cuddle up with your partner! The shower also wet the bathroom floor and toilet but as i wasn't cleaning it myself it didn't cause any problems. It was good having free internet access and worth waiting for on the odd occasion I had to. Staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet had a great choice and there was plenty to go around. The restaurant evening meal was very nice and very reasonably priced. I would definately stay here again
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The Grupotel is centrally located and sits between Metro stops Universitat and Catalunya. It is an ideal location for a first time visitor to Barcelona. Plaça de Catalunya, the "it" department store of Spain "El Corte Inglés" and a shopaholic's paradise on Avinguda del Portal de l'Angel is but a short walk away. Also right next to the hotel on the right is a little grocery store where you can get snacks and water. They seem to remain open late.
reviews.title: More than I expected! Wonderful experience!

likes.liked: — The room was huge! Very confortable!
likes.disliked: — The stairs I had to carry my luggage up on - it was 1 too many for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 324 (for 4 nights) which has a balcony overlooking Carrer de Pelai from which you could see Plaça de Catalunya. I didn't have any problem with the noise because I didn't hear any. The room by my European standards was huge! We had 2 closets, 2 twin beds, a 2 seater couch by which a table and chair shared room with, a writing desk and a flat screen tv which looked about 15". The bathroom was also quite spacious with enough room for 2 girls to walk in and out of while getting dressed/putting on makeup without getting into each other's way. It was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Enjoyed three wonderful nights at Gravina
Grupotel Gravina - Great
reviews.text: The staff was courteous and helpful with everything we asked them from recommendations for dinner to directions. We requested 2 wake up calls during our stay and I was expecting a phone call but instead they knock on your door to get you up which for a deep sleeper such as myself is quite helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at hotel for 5 nights and really don't have any complaints at all.Flew to Girona with Ryanair direct bus service to Barcelona bus station is right outside exit door of arrival hall (ticket window just to right of door 21 Euro return). Journey takes about 1hr15mins in fairly light traffic, taxi from bus station to hotel 7Euros (11 Euros for the return journey).
reviews.title: ideal hotel

likes.disliked: — lack of electric sockets (had to unplug fridge to use kettle)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was adequate size (noticed room next door was very small) good bathroom with hairdryer, kettle and cups provided but you have to buy tea,coffee and milk from the hotel bar(either take your own or there is a small supermarket right next to the hotel).Breakfasts couldn't be faulted, well worth going B&B as I think they cost 17Euro each to buy.Ate in hotel restaurant first night, meal ok but when the waitress asked if I wanted chips or vegetables I went for the health option veg expecting potatoes but only got carrots and courgettes so ask for both !! cost for two courses and a couple of drinks 38 euros for two. Sheet' s changed twice and fresh towels daily and room very clean.
reviews.title: Barcelona again??
Clean room w/nice sitting area
reviews.text: Barcelona Bus Turistic city tour buses highly recommended but get very busy,cheaper if you book on line before you go 2 consecutive days 23.40 euros adult ,just take your email voucher to tourist information at Pl. Catalunya (large square 5 minutes walk from the hotel where tour buses and the Barcelona Airport bus leave from), to get your tickets and book of money off vouchers.

reviews.title: Friendly staff,good facilities and a great location
reviews.text: Metro station 'Universitat' just around corner from hotel, very easy to use,modern clean and trains run every few minutes. Lines are numbered and colour coded,ticket machines touch screen just touch Union Jack flag for English translation 1.30 Euro flat rate for single journey but two day passes available.

reviews.title: Grupotel Gravina Barcalona
reviews.text: We also went to Montserrat about 1hr 30min by train from Barcelona,a large monastery and church perched on a mountain top.Tickets cost 20.90 euros adult and included Metro to rail station,train fare and cable car up the mountain worth doing if you have time but there isn't a lot to see when you get there. Cafes are expensive so you might want to take drinks and packed lunch.

reviews.title: Great little hotel
reviews.text: We just got back from Barcelona. This hotel is in a central location. The hotels close to Plaça de Catalunya (this is where the bus for the Turista starts and where the bus from the airport picks up/drops off). The hotel staff was extremely nice/helpful and spoke English. Our room was on the 1st floor 111 or something like that and it was super noisey. We had to buy earplugs to sleep; it sounded like people were moving furniture all hours of the night; I am not sure if there is a restaurant under our room?!?! The room was clean and had a nice sitting area seperate from the room. The beds are quite firm so if you do not like a firm mattress I would not recommend sleeping here, but I like my mattress firm. The location is excellent so any hotels in this area are a plus for location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending a long time searching for the right hotel in Barcelona, I deceded to choose this one due to the positive reviews of its location and standard for a 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.text: Staff are friendly and welcoming the location is down a side street and only a 5 minute walk from the Ramblas, and the main subway station at Placa de Catalunya. The room was of a fair size with a terrace and a nice clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is good with a wide choice of cheese, meats, fruits, juices, pastries, cereals and a cooked breakfast. Great to start you off on your day!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we were to return to Barcelona we would definately stay here again
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price.

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 8 nights and really enjoyed my stay there! A great location, very nice and clean room with fresh flowers and everything you could need there.
reviews.title: superb hotel, if only the beds were better

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a quick weekend trip and besides the location were not all that impressed. The cava at reception is a nice touch though we had to ask for a glass (?) We were in Gravina II which I think might be a newer section on the 5th floor. Because we were traveling with a small child we needed to use the elevator which barely held myself and a child, but you still had to go up stairs to get to the elevator to Gravina II.
reviews.title: What?! Just Ok
Nice hotel but dont buy tickets through them
reviews.text: THE MOVING FURNITURE SOUND UNCOVERED, it is the ceiling mounted radio speaker!! For some reason the radio can be controlled on the headboard of the bed and the speaker is mounted in the ceiling. Cool I guess, but the problem is even on volume as low as it will go it comes on supper supper loud with this "Errerrrt" sound, and you quickly turn it back off. Once we did it we started noticing others doing the same thing which does sound like furniture moving. The room initially looked good until closer inspection showed molding coming unglued and loose caulking in the shower. Not that big of a deal but maybe spend the $$ fixing these instead of a celing mounted radio that is useless! We were lucky enough not to get the two twin beds pushed together although this was the hardest bed I have slept on. (another place that $$ could have gone)

The breakfast is crap I tell you! and was more worth the 10Euros with the discount on the first day. Take a left when you exit the hotel and there is a wonderful bakery down the next street open early for freash breakfast. WAYYY better than my runny eggs and 4EUro Coke at the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel

likes.disliked: — It's a city hotel, so no views!

reviews.title: Perfect Location.
reviews.text: On the other hand the staff was very friendly and honest.
Im not saying this isnt a good hotel for the price and location, but I would look around before I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Nice food

description: The hotel Grupotel Gravina is located in a quiet street in the centre of Barcelona only 300 meters from the centre and the famous Plaça Catalunya, the nerve centre of the city. The Grupotel Gravina is a 19th century building that was refurbished in 2013 and has a façade listed as being of architectural interest.The hotel has two meeting rooms, one with a capacity for 44 people and the other for 55 people. Grupotel Gravina is open all year round.
